column2: Project Role : Program/Project Management Representativ Project Role Description : Deliver business and technology outcomes for assigned program, project, or contracted service. Leverage standard tools, methodologies and processes to deliver, monitor, and control service level agreements.  Must have skills : Oracle Utilities Work And Asset Management Good to have skills : NA Minimum  2  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Min 15 years of education Summary :As a Program/Project Management Representative, you will be responsible for delivering business and technology outcomes for assigned programs, projects, or contracted services. Your typical day will involve leveraging standard tools, methodologies, and processes to deliver, monitor, and control service level agreements.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the delivery of assigned programs, projects, or contracted services, ensuring business and technology outcomes are achieved within scope, budget, and timeline. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and mitigate risks, resolve issues, and ensure effective communication and stakeholder management. Utilize standard tools, methodologies, and processes to deliver, monitor, and control service level agreements, ensuring compliance with organizational policies and procedures. Provide regular status updates and reports to stakeholders, highlighting progress, issues, and risks, and recommending corrective actions as necessary. Continuously improve project management practices, leveraging industry best practices and lessons learned to enhance project delivery capabilities. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Experience in Oracle Utilities Work And Asset Management. Good To Have Skills:Experience in project management methodologies such as Agile or Waterfall. Strong understanding of project management principles, including scope, schedule, budget, risk, quality, and stakeholder management. Excellent communication, collaboration, and leadership skills, with the ability to influence and motivate cross-functional teams. Experience in managing multiple projects or programs simultaneously, with the ability to prioritize and manage competing demands. Solid analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and mitigate risks and issues proactively. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 2 years of experience in Oracle Utilities Work And Asset Management. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in project management, business administration, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering successful projects or programs. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification Min 15 years of education

column2: The Climate Resilient Cell (CRC) will be established at the Directorate of Agriculture, Government of Odisha (GoO). The CRC Coordinator will work under the supervision of Chief Research Coordinator, and will be the primary point of contact, working closely with project teams, stakeholders, line departments, farmer producer organisation (FPOs), and community members. The incumbent will coordinate with the Climate Support Cell (CSC), GoO, and ensure the project activities and outputs are aligned with the state s overall goals and objectives.          Responsibilities         Lead the team at Odisha in developing and implementing climate resilient agriculture strategies and action plans aligned with state polices.      Liaison with CSC, government agencies, FPOs, SHGs, research institutions, and other relevant stakeholders to facilitate knowledge sharing and effective implementation of climate smart practices.     Assist in establishing/strengthening effective coordination mechanisms among the stakeholders and other line departments to institutionalise and promote CSA in the state.     Provide technical expertise and support to nodal department/stakeholders to set up/review and monitor institutional mechanisms and processes to adopt or advance CSA in the state.      Oversee the planning, implementation, and monitoring, ensuring timely delivery of project objectives and outcomes.     Compile and disseminate relevant information, case studies, and best practices related to climate smart agriculture, facilitating knowledge sharing and learning among stakeholders.     Prepare timely and accurate progress reports, project updates, and technical briefs, and ensure effective communication with internal and external stakeholders.             Qualification         An advanced degree (mastres or PhD) in agriculture/ environment/ economics / public policy or a related field.             ?       Experience           At least 15 years of work experience at the national/state level in development projects (preferably on sustainable agriculture and climate resilience), including implementation and monitoring/evaluation of such projects.            ?       Skill Set         Strong knowledge and understanding of climate smart agriculture practises/technologies, climate change adaptation, and mitigation strategies.     Proven experience in project management, including planning, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation.     Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation frameworks and tools for assessing climate resilience.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with diverse stakeholders.     Proficiency in the use of relevant software applications and tools.     Proficiency in English, and a good command over Hindi and Odia is desirable.           The Adaptation & Risk Analysis group at CSTEP is looking for an intern to work on a short-term project on assessing the climate risks to RE assets in four Indian states. The intern will assist in conducting a literature study in order to produce policy recommendations for a climate-resilient RE future.               Create a thorough search plan for a grey literature review encompassing white papers and state reports from energy agencies.     Analyse annual reports and product catalogues to assess the quality control of assets like solar modules and wind turbines.     Review good practice guidelines and design considerations to be followed for installing RE       Qualifications       Good written and verbal communication skills.     Sound understanding of climate change risks.     Strong analytical skills, and prior experience in climate/energy projects.     Strong interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate effectively.     Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point) and open-source literature review tools

column2: ?       Samhita is a social impact consulting firm, with a vision to build a better normal . The better normal reimagines business environments where social value is an integral aspect of growth, putting stakeholders and environmental guardianship at the center of business strategy, a strategy that evolves from inputs to outcomes, from individuals to the ecosystem, and from delivering services to building capacity and enabling the market.     To do this, we support companies to align their core competencies with the needs of the social sector and build catalytic partnerships with stakeholders with in-depth knowledge and networks to execute sustainable, outcome-oriented social impact initiatives. column2: Project Role : Engineering Services Practitioner Project Role Description : Assist with end-to-end engineering services to develop technical engineering solutions to solve problems and achieve business objectives. Solve engineering problems and achieve business objectives using scientific, socio-economic, technical knowledge and practical experience. Work across structural and stress design, qualification, configuration and technical management.  Must have skills : Automotive Supply Chain Good to have skills : Technical Documentation, Project Management Office (PMO) Mobilization & Run, Automotive Engineering, MM PO Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelors degree in engineering Technical Communication Project Management or related field Masters degree or relevant certifications eg PMP PRINCE2 preferred About Industry X:- Industry X combines Accenture's powerful digital capabilities with deep engineering and manufacturing expertise. We use the power of data and digital to help our clients reimagine the products they make, and how they make them. By connecting engineering and manufacturing operations every step of the way - from how products are designed and engineered, sourced and supplied, manufactured, to how they are serviced and renewed, we help them achieve greater productivity, drive growth and meet their sustainability commitments. Know more:- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XaLxTEI3atI WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? Overview about the project/team>> Exposure to work with a leading global automaker and provider of innovative mobility solutions. Pool of opportunities to nourish your career and learning path. Innovative working culture with a challenging roles and responsibilities. What you would do in this role Coordinate and facilitate the planning, execution, and closure of projects related to automotive technical publications. Ensure alignment with organizational goals, timelines, and budgets. Oversee the creation, review, and publication of technical documents, manuals, and guides related to automotive products or services. Maintain version control, track changes, and ensure adherence to industry standards and regulations. Serve as a liaison between cross-functional teams, including Onshore, Off-shore, quality assurance, to gather project's requirements, provide updates, and address concerns related to technical publications projects. Allocate resources effectively to support multiple projects concurrently. Monitor resource utilization, identify potential bottlenecks, and propose solutions to optimize productivity and workflow efficiency. Identify potential risks and dependencies that may impact project delivery. Develop mitigation strategies, contingency plans, and escalation procedures to address issues proactively and minimize disruptions. Generate regular progress reports, status updates, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to stakeholders and management. Track project milestones, deliverables, and expenditures to ensure alignment with project objectives and organizational priorities. Continuously assess project management processes, tools, and methodologies to identify areas for improvement. Recommend and implement enhancements to streamline workflows, enhance collaboration, and drive operational excellence. Who we are looking for? Bachelor's degree in engineering, Technical Communication, Project Management, or related field. Master's degree or relevant certifications (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) preferred. Proven experience in project management, preferably in the automotive industry, with a focus on technical publications, documentation management, or related fields. Strong knowledge of automotive systems, components, and technologies. Familiarity with industry standards and regulatory requirements is desirable. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex technical information in a clear and concise manner. Experience in technical writing, editing, or content development is a plus. Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., Microsoft Project, JIRA, Power BI) and document management systems (e.g., Adobe FrameMaker, Arbortext, SharePoint). Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Ability to prioritize tasks, manage conflicting priorities, and adapt to changing requirements in a fast-paced environment. Leadership qualities with a collaborative and proactive approach to team management. Experience leading cross-functional teams and driving consensus among stakeholders. Attention to detail and a commitment to quality, with a focus on delivering accurate and reliable technical publications that meet customer needs and expectations. Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law Qualification Bachelors degree in engineering Technical Communication Project Management or related field Masters degree or relevant certifications eg PMP PRINCE2 preferred

column2: Clarity PPM (Broadcom PPM) plays a key role in WDC s entire Engineering and RD functions business planning and decision making     Clarity serves as a system of record in terms of Programs and Projects portfolio management, Resource planning and tracking, OpEx and CapEx detailed Planning and tracking, etc             Job Purpose           In this position, you will assume an overall responsibility and accountability for Clarity PPM platform, including but not only to on-going enhancements, new features, capabilities, modules, New UX, Integration and interfaces with other systems, requirement gathering, design, development, communication and rollout.     In addition, you will also be responsible for Clarity analytics that includes new and existing reports design, enhancement and development along with Tableau based dashboards.     The candidate will also lead the global users periodic training and key users community.             In this role, you will         Drive the utilization, enhancement, and evolution of the Clarity PPM tool ensuring scalability to meet evolving business needs.     Manage system updates, testing, and related activities including the creation and execution of test scripts, coordination of UAT testing, communications, etc     Lead systems training globally across a wide-ranging end-user community including PMO, Functional Planner, Power Users/Clarity Champions, Project Managers, and Time Entry users, educating all on the capabilities the platform offers as it relates to their expansive and expanding project portfolios     Develop and maintain systems related artifacts and documentation, training materials, and valuable insights for users on WDC SharePoint site website     Utilize your superior troubleshooting abilities and analytical skills to provide in-depth functional and user support to WDC s Clarity community at an enterprise level       Bachelors Degree in computer science, Industrial Engineering or Information Technology related.     At least 5 years of experience in functional modules (like Project Management, Portfolio Management, Resource Management, Timesheet Manage

column2: As a Senior Associate, youll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:      Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.      Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.      Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.      Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.      Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.      Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice.      Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives.      Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others.      Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships.      Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                    Join the Digital Revolution and the future of Project Management : AC Digital PMO Services is Hiring!              Do you have a passion for cutting-edge digital solutions, AI, and transformative project managementAre you ready to be a part of a trailblazing team driving unprecedented growth and client opportunitiesIf so, your opportunity is here. The AC Digital PMO Services Team at PwC is expanding and we invite you to join us on this remarkable journey.             Why Join AC Digital PMO Services            Pioneering Impact:      We are at the forefront of the digital PMO revolution, leveraging AI, automation, and advanced analytics to redefine project management.         Largest Pool of Certified Talent:     Join the largest pool of PMP and Agile certified professionals in the entire PwC network, revolutionizing the way we deliver projects.         Exponential Career Growth:      In our environment of immense growth and client opportunities, your career will skyrocket.         Innovative Culture:      We re constantly pushing the boundaries, seeking innovative solutions that drive success in every engagement.         Global Client Network:      Work with esteemed clients across industries, building relationships and delivering excellence.         Open Positions:                  PMO Consultant             Strong Experience in Project Engagement Financials:     Lead the financial management of projects, ensuring precise budgeting, forecasting, tracking, and reporting to optimize cost and value.          End-to-End Project Management:      Manage projects from initiation to closure, demonstrating mastery in planning, executing, monitoring, controlling, and closing projects successfully.         Profound Knowledge of PMO Tools:     Leverage industry-standard PMO tools to create project schedules, track progress, manage resources, and report key metrics to stakeholders.         In-depth Understanding of SDLC and Agile Methodologies:      Apply expert knowledge of various software development life cycles and Agile frameworks to guide projects, ensuring alignment with best practices.         Stakeholder Communication and Management:     Foster strong relationships with clients and internal stakeholders, ensuring clear and effective communication throughout the project lifecycle.         Risk and Issue Management:      Proactively identify, assess, and manage risks and issues, devising and implementing mitigation strategies to ensure project success.         Mentoring and Team Development:     Provide guidance and mentorship to junior staff, contributing to their professional development and enhancing the overall capability of the PMO team.         Agile Advocate and Practitioner:      Champion Agile principles within the project team and organization, facilitating Scrum, Kanban, or other Agile ceremonies, and continuously promoting a culture of improvement

column2: Vera is seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Program Associate to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing multiple projects, ensuring seamless coordination between teams, and maintaining up-to-date statuses across all initiatives. As the Program Associate, you will play a critical role in driving timely deliverables, keeping stakeholders informed, and managing outputs throughout the development /project lifecycle. Additionally, you will also serve as the Scrum Manager, facilitating sprint planning, development cycles, and release management activities.         Primary Responsibilities:           Manage and coordinate multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives and timelines.           Act as the primary point of contact for project teams, facilitating communication and collaboration between stakeholders.         Monitor project progress and identify potential risks or roadblocks, proactively implementing solutions to mitigate issues.         Maintain up-to-date project documentation, including schedules, timelines, and deliverables.         Conduct regular status meetings with project teams to review progress, address challenges, and ensure clarity on tasks and priorities.         Collaborate with Product Owners /Project Owners to define project goals, requirements, and success criteria.         Work closely with development teams to prioritize tasks, resolve blockers, and ensure timely delivery of features and enhancements including backlog grooming and roadmap planning.         Serve as the Scrum Manager, leading sprint planning sessions, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives ensuring teams meet the sprint goals and objectives.         Manage all agile ceremonies, the release process, coordinating with QA teams, deployment specialists, and stakeholders to ensure smooth product launches including JIRA maintenance.       Qualifications and Experience       Essential:         Bachelor s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or related field.         Proven experience in Program Management, Project Management or related roles.         Strong understanding of Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum.         Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders, including negotiation skills, conflict management and context switching skills.         Proficiency in project management tools and software such as Jira, Confluence, Lucid, Miro, Figma, Trello, Notion, etc.         Knowledge of techniques for filling in the gaps in the Scrum approach on a need basis e.g.: burndown techniques, multiple retrospective formats, bug triaging, PI planning, etc.         Desirable:         Agile or Scrum Certification (CSP, PSM).         Knowledge of other Agile approaches: XP, Kanban, Crystal, FDD, etc.         Knowledge and/or experience with widely successful Agile techniques: User Stories, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games

column2: Developing project Charter     Define project scope and deliverables that support business goals     Develop project plans and schedule     Communicate with stakeholders/customers on an ongoing basis      Set and continually manage project expectations with team members and customers     Draft and submit budget proposals, and recommend subsequent budget changes where necessary      Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path     Plan and schedule project timelines and milestones using appropriate tools (Microsoft Project Management)      Track project milestones and deliverables     Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation and presentations      Issue status reports to the project team, analyse results, and troubleshoot problem areas      Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans      Define project success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout project life cycle.      Build, develop, and grow business relationships vital to the success of the project.      Conduct project lessons learned meetings and create a recommendations report in order to identify successful and unsuccessful project elements     Develop best practices and tools for project execution and management               Educational Qualifications           Post-Graduation: MBA (preferable)     Engineering (B.E / B.Tech / M.E / M.Tech) in IT/Computer Science/ Electronics / Telecommunication OR MCA               Certifications         Having one or more of the following certifications will be an added advantage:       PMP     Prince-2     TOGAF     ITIL     COBIT     Six Sigma Green / Black Belt               Work Experience           The candidate should possess post-qualification relevant work experience of 3 to 8 years in Consulting /IT/ITES firm.     Experience of working with Indian Government (Central, State, ULBs)/related agencies is preferred. However, this will not be a mandatory requirement. column2: Clarity PPM (Broadcom PPM) plays a key role in WDC s entire Engineering and R&D functions business planning and decision making.      Clarity serves as a system of record in terms of Programs and Projects portfolio management,      Resource planning and tracking, OpEx and CapEx detailed Planning and tracking, etc.            Job Purpose        In this position, you will assume an overall responsibility and accountability for Clarity PPM platform, including but not only to on-going enhancements, new features, capabilities, modules, New UX, Integration and interfaces with other systems, requirement gathering, design, development, communication and rollout.      In addition, you will also be responsible for Clarity analytics that includes new and existing reports design, enhancement and development along with Tableau based dashboards.      The candidate will also lead the global users periodic training and key users community.            In this role, you will:      Drive the utilization, enhancement, and evolution of the Clarity PPM tool ensuring scalability to meet evolving business needs.      Manage system updates, testing, and related activities including the creation and execution of test scripts, coordination of UAT testing, communications, etc.      Lead systems training globally across a wide-ranging end-user community including PMO, Functional Planner, Power Users/Clarity Champions, Project Managers, and Time Entry users, educating all on the capabilities the platform offers as it relates to their expansive and expanding project portfolios      Develop and maintain systems related artifacts and documentation, training materials, and valuable insights for users on WDC SharePoint site website      Utilize your superior troubleshooting abilities and analytical skills to provide in-depth functional and user support to WDC s Clarity community at an enterprise level          Bachelor s Degree in computer science, Industrial Engineering or Information Technology related.      At least 5 years of experience in functional modules (like Project Management, Portfolio Management, Resource Management, Timesheet Management, Financial Management, Demand Management and Jaspersoft reports) of Clarity.      Configure Clarity PPM and translating requirements into design and workable solution      Good understanding of Clarity Administration like Time Period Setup, Resource Setup, Project Financials, Security and Permissions Management, Jobs setup and scheduling Processes, Jaspersoft Report scheduling, Financial setup, new UX      Good understanding of the Clarity PPM Data Architecture      Extensive experience in SQL and XOG      knowledge and Experience with the new Clarity UI functionalities, capabilities and configuration.      Strong understanding of database concepts (Oracle, generic SQL, relational modeling/DB design)      Knowledge and experience with a BI analytics tool such as Tableau or PowerBI      Knowledge in GEL Script, REST API, Process automation and Integrations a benefit      Interact with Vendor Support to resolve issues related to environment, performance etc.      Interact with other IT departments to resolve issues related to integrations, Database issues, Security, etc.      Professional experience building high-quality apps or services from the ground up and scaling at an enterprise level      Strong analytical, debugging and problem-solving skills      Ability to handle multiple competing tasks and meet deadlines, work efficiently and productively, communicate, both verbally and written              Advantage    : Previous PMO knowledge and experience in focus on program and financials planning and tracking (OPEX/CAPEX) etc.

column2: Are you looking to make a real difference on a global scale       As a Senior Associate in C-Quest Capital s Carbon and Sustainability Accounting Team (CSAT),          you will have the opportunity to work on methodology development, methodology applications to new concepts, assist in transformational and sustainable strategies, assist in developing monitoring survey and design sampling approaches across various regions in a truly global, multicultural workspace                         The Carbon and Sustainability Accounting Team (CSAT),       is responsible for all aspects of carbon and sustainability accounting and compliance management for CQCs growing portfolio of projects, which currently number more than 90 projects and growing           CQC is active in a number of different carbon verticals in both reductions and avoidance including household devices, fuel switching, industrial energy efficiency, renewable energy, avoided methane emissions and methane capture and use, as well as nature-based carbon credits, including, but not limited to those associated with bamboo afforestation, restoration forestry, farmer managed natural restoration, assisted natural restoration, other forms of regenerative agriculture and sustainable forestry management and soil carbon accumulation              Key Responsibilities:                           Provide technical support in project conceptualization, planning, implementation and monitoring to adhere to the guidelines outlined under the GHG crediting program, specifically SD VISta.              Assist in determining the sustainable development related benefits achievable from different project activities under other programs like Voluntary Carbon Standard (VCS), Gold Standard (GS) etc              Playing a key role in ensuring the quality of documents in various stages of validation and verification, including reviewing project documentation, analyzing survey results, etc             Assisting in planning and development of data collection tools such as developing questionnaires designed to understand baseline scenarios and monitoring project activities in different countries             Assist and gradually take responsibility for providing technical training to the on-field team members at regular intervals, to ensure smooth functioning of the project.              Providing regular trainings to CSAT team members regarding latest guidelines, tools, methodologies, etc to enable constant up-skilling of the team.                The successful candidate must have experience working in a carbon/ climate change domain.                  Prior experience would include:                   Minimum 3+ years of relevant working experience in a fast-paced environment with a matrix organization structure.             Solid understanding of the concept of sustainable development and attributes associated with the sustainable development goals              In-depth understanding of various GHG crediting programs such as the Clean Development Mechanism (CDM), Verified Carbon Standard (VCS), SD VISta, Gold Standard, Article 6.             Experience in carbon project methodology development is preferred             Strong knowledge of sampling approaches for household energy efficiency projects.             Working experience with a multi-country/multi-cultural team and/or with developmental agencies.             Minimum of a Bachelor s degree.             A master s degree in the field of energy and/or environment, engineering is preferred.               Key Skills/Abilities:                   Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize and deliver efficiently and effectively under deadlines.             Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills and the ability to articulate their communications when reporting/representing data clearly and concisely.             Ability to coordinate with teams spread across different locations in India, Africa, Southeast Asia.             Able to work well in culturally diverse environment.             A passion to actively help the rural poor in less developed countries in line with the UN Sustainable Development Goals.             Good numerate skills.             An ability to fit in with the high-performance and collaborative culture of CQC.             An ability to self-manage day to day activities.                   Travel   :       The expectation is that the Senior Associate will have occasional travel in the operating regions, but the majority of the time this role will be Pune/Delhi-based
column11: Renewable energy, Accounting, Project management, Data collection, Conceptualization, CSAT, Sustainable development, Operations, Monitoring, Technical support

column2: Description :-  SmartStream, a global software and managed services provider to the worlds top banks, asset managers, custodians and broker dealers, has an excellent opportunity for a Project Management Office (PMO) Support Analyst/Financial Force - Professional Services Automation (PSA) Administrator. The role entails assisting the PMO group streamline and enhance their project reporting and governance procedures. Focus will naturally encompass: process improvement; quality control; providing management information to senior management; supporting senior management with resource management, budgeting and forecasts. This is an excellent role for an autonomous individual in which to develop their career in a fast-paced environment. column2: Job Overview: We are in search of a seasoned and achievement-oriented professional for the position of NPD (New Product Development) and Artwork Project Executive to become a valuable member of our Startup team. The perfect candidate will demonstrate a proven history of effectively steering complete NPD projects and supervising artwork processes. This involves ensuring punctual delivery, adherence to regulatory standards, and the facilitation of high-quality production. If you are a meticulous professional with robust project management capabilities, this role presents an enticing chance to make a meaningful contribution to the expansion and triumph of our company. Key Responsibilities: NPD and Project Management: Spearhead the introduction of new product lines, guiding the entire journey from conceptualization to in-store introduction and subsequent post-launch assistance. Effectively handle numerous product launch initiatives concurrently, encompassing proposition testing and continuous assistance for post-launch endeavours. Project-manage the launch of brand portfolios, guaranteeing strategic coherence with organizational objectives. Conduct comprehensive packaging material reviews to optimize product presentation and protection. Implement fitment testing processes to ensure products seamlessly integrate with intended applications. Oversee palletization strategies to enhance logistical efficiency and minimize transportation risks. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline packaging, fitment, and palletization procedures for optimal results. Artwork Project Management: Facilitate seamless communication and collaboration between internal stakeholders (marketing, regulatory, logistics, finance) and external partners (pack change analysts, site, artwork houses) in the artwork process. Ensure adherence to regulatory standards and compliance across multiple markets and languages. Coordinate the artwork process within the supply chain, involving various internal departments and external parties such as factories, printers, and artwork providers. Manage project timelines and deliverables to meet artwork production schedules, taking ownership of timely artwork changes and escalating issues to key stakeholders. Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with external artwork providers, printers, and suppliers to achieve high-quality and cost-effective artwork production. Qualifications, Personal, and Professional Attributes: Possess a Bachelor's degree or PMP certification in Marketing, Business, or a related field. Experience required  1.6 to 2 years Demonstrated expertise in project management for New Product Development,with a preference for experience in the consumer goods industry. Showcase outstanding project management and organizational skills. Exhibit effective communication and collaboration abilities, fostering strong relationships both internally and externally. Display proficiency in managing multiple projects concurrently, ensuring timely and successful outcomes. Embrace a proactive problem-solving approach and maintain a mindset focused on continuous improvement. Demonstrate meticulous attention to detail and the ability to anticipate and address potential issues.

column2: The Senior Associate / Manager SHD Office will be part of a small, core team which will assist in building out the School over the coming years. The core responsibility of this position will be to assist in the development and implementation of the School s strategy.     The incumbent will support governance, strategic and operational planning, the management of resources (people, physical and financial), development and delivery of the academic courses, external engagement, relationship building with key partners and collaborators, and knowledge management and outreach. S/he will act as one of the primary links between SHD and various programmes, labs, and other schools at IIHS. Along with individual faculty and other team members, s/he will need to ensure coordination and timely delivery of outcomes.         Activities and Tasks       Responsibilities would include, but not be limited to, the following:     Strategy and Planning:       Supporting operational and strategic planning, governance, budgeting, resource management and personnel planning;         Coordinating various initiatives of the School, including overall programme management as well as budgeting;         Planning, overseeing and implementing school-wide systems and processes for activities as needed;         Generating business development strategies (including periodic updates on the market landscape), and identifying opportunities and initiatives in partnership with faculty / staff and in line with the strategic objectives of the School;         Designing, commissioning/conducting research on domains related to the school, as well as preparing briefing and information papers;       Relationship Management and Communications:       Assisting in the development and management of external relationships and collaboration opportunities with key domestic and international partners, and collaborators;         Ensuring effective communication across the School and with the wider institution, and positive working relations with other schools and programmes;         Representing the School on committees or other forums, where required, and advocating for the interests of the School as with those of the institution;         Collaboration with the communication and design team, developing and supporting in execution of communication strategy;       Operations:       Assisting in setting up and ensuring continuous improvement in the infrastructure, and administrative systems and procedures for the School s activities;         Managing the interface among various programmes, labs, schools, administration, procurement, finance and legal;         Monitoring resources, processes and deliverables of projects delivered by the programmes within the School;         Supporting and coordinating the development and delivery of specialised degree / diploma programmes including preparatory activities, content delivery, internships and placements, stakeholder management, and reporting;         Managing and monitoring recruitment, staff progress, and learning and development for the School in consultation with the Associate Deans and the People Function;         Assisting in regular reporting to the Associate Dean on key milestones and highlighting critical concerns and risks;         Coordinating the preparation of the School s Annual Report and contributing towards the preparation of the institution s Annual Report;         Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations and others;         Participating in all activities of institution building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within or outside the country as and when needed.         Structure and Reporting        The Senior Associate / Manager will report to the Associate Dean School of Human Development at IIHS and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and external individuals/organizations, and students.       Person Specification       The applicant should have:       A Master s degree in a relevant field including but not limited to Planning/ Public Policy/ Public Administration/ Management/ Social Work/ or across the Social Sciences and Humanities, or a related field;         A total of 5 to 8 years of administrative or management experience, ideally in the urban or development sector;         Prior experience in academic management and administration or a similar domain is preferred, or strong experience in programme management;         Experience of working in inter-disciplinary teams, preferably across practice and research;         Strong writing, analytical and numerical skills;         A high level of organisational capability, including the ability to establish and maintain effective systems, procedures and processes and manage competing demands and deadlines without compromising quality;         A high level of communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to consult and collaborate with inter-disciplinary and diverse teams; analyse and present information and produce well researched high-quality reports, submissions, and other documents; negotiate complex issues and manage change;         The ability to think strategically, contribute effectively to strategic planning processes and to operationalise strategy with the administrative operations of the School;         Effective working knowledge of at least one Indian language.
column11: Relationship management, Procurement, Administration, Analytical, Relationship building, Strategic planning, Budgeting, Resource management, Monitoring, Recruitment

Coordinate with the community educators and ensure the complete cluster-level implementation process.     Coordinate with the state program associate to conduct state-level program meetings and workshops.     Submit to the Program Lead, timely information of the analysis and evaluation of the progress and results of the program in the cluster.     Conduct working visits to the field areas within the cluster in consultation with the Program lead and compile qualitative field visit reports.     Organize monthly review meetings and quarterly meetings with community educators to update and improve the program quality.     Assist program lead in preparation of the program design, proposals etc      Represent Organization overview in presentations to educators and community groups.     Provide assistance in planning and arrangement of trainings, and meetings in the community level.     Maintain routine correspondence with Program finance associate and program HR.     May assist in developing and coordinating program-related conferences, conventions, or meetings.     Responsible for budget management as per the allocation for each activity in the cluster         Participate in any other activities which may be required to be undertaken to fulfil the objectives of the organization.         Maintain documentation, such as plans and reports, assigning tasks and controlling schedules to Community Educators Volunteers as per required formats and timelines.     Maintain cluster level program documents in the field office.     Ensure all the relevant data is available and submitted on time.     Ensure the program process is documented and enough case studies are in place to show the impact or progress of the program.         Ensure that the data is analysed and feeds into the planning and review meeting.         Identification of needs and providing technical expertise to partners and Caritas India direct implementation program     Accompaniment to partners and regular visits to direct intervention project locations to provide feedback for timely corrective measures.         Train and coach, the community educators in the cluster based on results-oriented program approach.     Identify the gaps in the operational capabilities of community educators and plan for their capacity development in discussion with the line manager.     Ensure that the team works together to share learning and to exchange skills.         Provide guidance, mentorship, and effective knowledge management within the team to ensure smooth program delivery.         Promotes good co- operation with the Caritas India partners in the cluster.         Identify the issues in the project areas, discuss and help concerned Caritas India partners to prepare concept notes in consultation with the state program associate as per the requirement.       NETWORK, STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT/LINKAGES CI VISIBILITY        Facilitate in the communication of the program progress to concerned team members and other cluster level stakeholders.     As a representative of Caritas India in the region, maintain good contacts with relevant authorities and other organizations in the region.     Identify and facilitate potential local donors from the area in consultation with the line manager.         Ensure timely meetings with relevant government departments to effectively manage the project activities.         Conceptualize innovative ideas and formulate concept notes, proposals from field learning and insight and tap for funding and other inputs.     Identify and document as knowledge products emerging from the programs of Caritas India and her partners in the form of case stories, best practices, reports, presentations, photos, videos, government letters, event reports, IEC materials, etc     Conduct knowledge exchange moments with stakeholders, Caritas India staff, Partners, local governance, community, district, state government Donors to ensure learning and know-hows among all.     Conduct research for upgrading, developing, and synthesizing models which could be replicated.         Accountable for effective usage and management of all the resources and assets of Caritas India and Gram Nirman program     Ensuring Caritas India resources are utilized optimally and effectively by partners and program teams.     Maintain and update all registers and imprest account and other financial documents on regular basis and share with Caritas India Head office as and when required.     Perform in such a way that partners actively seek Caritas India officer s expertise beyond Caritas India projects.         Field Program Implementation Lead cum Tribal Outreach Lead for all strategic and operational inputs on the program     Manager Program Finance support in maintaining and tracking the fund flow.     Lead HR assistance in identifying capacity building needs, creation of internal bonding within the team.     Community Educators in getting the first-hand experience and knowledge right from the field for strengthening the project.       With volunteers, stakeholders engaged under this program.     Government and Non-Government institution to leverage the available resources.     Like minded NGOs for knowledge exchanges       PROFESSIONAL SPECIFICATIONS         Knowledge of the social reality, socio-political context, its causes, and implications in the areas of operation     Ability to put knowledge and principles into practice for effective program management in alignment with organizational values.     Ability to carry out regular assessments and studies on emerging issues in operations.     Ability to assess the need for organizational development interventions and facilitate the same Ability to analyze and design interventions that address specific aspects of change in operations.     Knowledge about Government policies and programs, legislations, donor s policies and standards and compliances for critically accessing the same in the area of operations.     Knowledge of other stakeholders and like-minded organizations and their focus areas for interventions     Ability to find opportunities to leverage the strengths of other like-minded organizations and work constructively in addressing specific issues.     Ability to apply Caritas India program quality standards and RBM concepts and practices in program management processes and activities.       Skills     Excellent presentation, public speaking, and interpersonal skills     Strong communication skills (both verbal and written)     Strong computer skills, with familiarity in using Microsoft Office suite applications.     Leadership and effective team management skills     Training and capacity building     Ability to liaise, network and engage with stakeholders.     Local partnering and external engagement along with cross-functional and cross-sector collaboration     Decision making and conflict resolution.       Organized, team player, self-starter and results-oriented individual.     Be gender sensitive with strong conviction and skills for the empowerment of excluded and disadvantaged children.     Advocating, lobbying, communication and influencing on matters of program importance     Ability to work and deliver in a highly demanding and performance-based project.     Demonstrate a high degree of honesty and integrity.     Ability and willingness to work under pressure and flexible schedule.         Master s degree or MSW/ MBA / PG Social Work/ Rural Development or equivalent; having 8-10 years of experience working at the grassroots in development projects.     Experience in community developmental projects shall be an added value.     Previous experience of leading state level multi stake holder project can be an advantage.     Willing to travel to the project work areas

column2: The Global Partnering Associate will assist the Global Partnering Manager in the identification, selection, qualification, risk management assessment and onboarding of new and existing Good Practice (GxP) vendors. This individual will participate in clinical science processes, contributing to the new Request for Proposals (RFPs) and post award stage of the studies via collaboration with external vendors and internal Key stakeholders.          Responsibilities            Assists Global Partnering Manager in identifying, selecting, qualifying, risk management and onboarding of new and existing GxP vendors.        Makes necessary updates to the consolidated and controlled GxP vendor list, as required.      Works closely with the Contracts team to facilitate and sign off the non-disclosure agreement (NDA) with the GxP vendors.      Communicates with Quality Assurance (QA) and other functions, as required, about the qualification status of any GxP vendor. Coordinates with QA to schedule the type, frequency, and extent of audit(s) for any GxP vendor.      Maintains awareness of legislation applicable in the US, UK and other jurisdictions which may affect GxP vendors globally (e.g., General Data Protection Regulation, UK Bribery Act) and ensures compliance.      Participates and contributes to any new initiative within Global Partnering Function.      Conducts internal surveys on an ongoing basis to obtain feedback from the team and shares the feedback with the Global Partnering Manager.      Proactively coordinates with all the Project Managers (PMs) working on the awarded study for the critical issues and escalations to the GxP vendors. Schedules governance calls with vendors to discuss and resolve the critical issues and escalations, takes minutes and follows up on the action items. Performs other duties as assigned.                Qualifications            Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Pharmacy degree, or any related bachelors degree required.        Master of Pharmacy or Master of Business Administration (MBA) preferred.      Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus.      Minimum of 4 years of experience in Partner/Vendor Management, Clinical Operations, or Project Management in Pharmaceutical/Biotech or Clinical Research organization.

column2: Project Role : Project Control Services Practitioner Project Role Description : Support projects in the Technology Delivery Centers by tracking and managing project management office activities. Proactively monitor, manage and report on execution of deliverables.  Must have skills : Program Control Services Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : 15 years of fulltime of education Summary :As a Project Control Services Practitioner, you will be responsible for tracking and managing project management office activities. Your typical day will involve proactively monitoring, managing, and reporting on the execution of deliverables in Hyderabad.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the project management office activities and ensure timely delivery of project deliverables. Track and manage project schedules, budgets, and resources to ensure project success. Proactively monitor project risks and issues, and develop mitigation plans to minimize their impact. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project deliverables are met on time and within budget. Communicate project status and progress to stakeholders, including senior management, using appropriate reporting tools. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Strong experience in Program Control Services. Good To Have Skills:Experience in project management tools such as Microsoft Project or Primavera. Experience in project management methodologies such as Agile or Waterfall. Strong understanding of project management principles, including scope, schedule, budget, and risk management. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Program Control Services. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in project management, business administration, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering successful projects. This position is based at our Hyderabad office. Qualification 15 years of fulltime of education

Other Support Duties as Needed: Performs other duties or special projects as required or as assigned Knowledge of Agile / Scrum methodology  Writing user stories, managing scrum calls, prioritizing backlog, etc. Experience in getting business requirement and converting user requirement into functional requirement. column2: A cross  Levels  Comms & Media  Telecom  OSS Transformation  Consult ing Join our team in Strategy consulting to find endless opportunities and solve  our clients' toughest challenges, as you  collaborate  with  exceptional people, the latest  technology,  and leading companies across industries. Practice: Comms & Media , Industry Consulting,  S&C  Global  Network  (GN) Areas of Work: Telecom  Service Assurance / Service Fulfilment/ Telecom Network Operations /Network IT Level: Analyst / Consultant Experience :1 to 7 years Location: Gurgaon, Mumbai,  Bangalore , Pune,  Hyderabad,  Kolkata , Chennai Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture Are you an outcome-oriented problem solver? Do you enjoy working on transformation strategies for global clients? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest?  Then,  is the right place for you to explore limitless possibilities. Comms & Media (C&M) is one of the Industry Practices within Accenture's  Global  Network ( G N  Team )  in Strategy & Consulting (S&C ).  It focuses in serving clients across specific Industries Communications, Media & Entertainment. Communications  Focuses primarily on industries related with telecommunications and information & communication technology (ICT). This dynamic team serves most of the world's leading wireline, wireless, cable and satellite communications and service providers.  Media & Entertainment  Focuses on industries like broadcast, entertainment, print and publishing.  Globally,  works to develop value growth strategies for its clients, who are top-notch organizations, and help improve their offers and go-to-market performance and maximize organizational effectiveness. We work on end-to-end projects delivering management and technology consultancy to help our clients achieve greater profitability,  quality,  and reliability. From multi-year major systems integration transformation deals to shorter more agile engagements, we have a rapidly expanding portfolio of hyper-growth clients and an increasing footprint with next-gen technology and industry practices ,  with the following  requirements : Support or lead delivery in small to medium-size teams  to deliver management consulting projects for global clients.  Support or lead innovation transformation  programs and process enablement for our clients.  Develop assets & point-of-view (POV) or white papers  for use by the team and larger community.  Support or lead proposals, business development for global clients  as an expert for a specific domain areain coordination with other team members.  Experience  to engage with stakeholders independently.  Execute a transformational change plan aligned with client's business strategy  and context for change. Engage stakeholders in the change journey and build commitment for change.  Facilitate workshops, interviews, and requirements  gathering sessions with stakeholders to elicit, prioritize, and validate requirements, ensuring a clear understanding of business needs and objectives.  Work closely with cross-functional teams  to translate business requirements into technical specifications and create user stories for implementation by development teams.  Must-Have Proven experience in business analysis leveraging requirement gathering techniques to conduct in-depth assessments of OSS applications/capabilities (i.e.Inventory management, Performance Management, Service Activation, Service Assurance etc.), data, and processes to identify gaps and propose effective solutionsutilizing industry best practices  Experience todocument business processes, use cases, and functional requirements for OSS feature enhancements/modernization, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives  Well versed with Agile methodologies with experience on Confluence and Jiraetc.  Experience of delivering consulting projects related to Digital transformation, Operating Model Design, Business Process Re-engineering, Business case creation, Identification of AI/OPS/service assurance use cases, NOC/SOC processes etc.  Good understanding on Network Operation Analytics - AI based Service Assurance use cases to drive business/operations benefits.  Good understanding of OSS tools ecosystem like:ServiceNow, BMC Remedy, Nokia NetAct, HPSM, Netcool, Blue planet, Cramer, etc.  Qualification Good to  have. Good understanding of creating value driver trees to breakdown into value components of business objectives and value driver Working knowledge of Automation across RPA / Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning/GenAI, etc. is a plus. Ability to document and visualize As-Is and To-Be processes on tools like Visio, Draw.io etc. Your experience counts! MBA from a Tier 1 and Tier 2 school and Engineering from Tier 1school or rich relevant industry experience Certifications related to TMForum- eTOM,ITIL, CBAP or similar is mandatory Direct onsite experience (i.e., experience of facing client inside client offices in India or abroad) is mandatory. Please note we are looking for client facing roles Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools to extract insights from network data Help identify and structure key client challenges into hypotheses and conduct analyses to address the challenges Strong analytical, problem-solving skills and good communication skills Should have Cross-cultural competence with an ability to thrive in a dynamic environment Excellent presentation making and excel skills

column2: A career within Technology Strategy services, will provide you with the opportunity to help organisations develop strategies that transform their technology capabilities and solve their most critical challenges     We focus on building technology enabled and agile operating models, planning their new enterprise architecture into a differentiating capability system that helps them win in the market, leveraging digital analytics to enhance the customer experience and optimising business operations, and using modern management techniques such as robotic process automation and next generation sourcing strategies to help our clients get fit for growth           Responsibilities:       Responsible for overall project schedule planning which includes developing and coordinating realistic     project plan, including key milestones, success metrics, and drive progress to achieve project plan within time     and budget constraints from concept to launch for US based customers     Manage end to end implementation project for any of the Adobe Marketing Cloud solution (AEM, Adobe     Analytics, Target Campaign)     Ability to lead a team of large pool of Technical Architects and Business/ Technical Consultants.     Professional demeanor, ability to interact with and lead diverse teams throughout Adobe and communicate     with client partner, customer success managers, CXOs and Industry lead     Proactively research customer needs and exercise appropriate creativity in recommending new solutions,     based on the Adobe s Digital Marketing platform to fulfill those needs.     Understand and assess scope, critical paths and dependencies for delivering and shipping digital products and     facilitate discussions across all functions stakeholders     Anticipate bottlenecks, identify, assess, track and mitigate issues, risks and work with team members and     management to mitigate and escalate as deemed suitable     Support project estimation process with key contributors to help define scope and prepare statements of     work, including tasks, deliverables, milestones, resources, and estimated costs     Manage all day-to-day administrative activities of a given project from inception to closure such as reviewing     timesheets, analyze plan versus actual figures, managing monthly/quarterly financial closing and invoicing     Maintain regular communication with both the customer and internal teams, and constantly manage     customer expectations (also in critical situations or throughout escalations)     Achieve customer satisfaction through successful deployments of digital solutions     Compile customer requests and deployment issues, to provide a feedback channel into our core products.     Work with third-party subcontractors and technology partners as required     Act as the central point of contact throughout the life of the project, capture and communicate experiences in     formal post-mortem, feeding lessons learned, best practices and resources back into the consulting practice     Manage weekly resource planning and financial forecast updates     Contribute to operational best practices by formalizing and/or improving processes and standards       Required Expertise:       Experience in Digital Marketing cloud solutions (Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Target, Adobe     Campaign, Adobe Analytics)     Experience in Technical Program Management, should be able to drive 15-20 projects in parallel     Experience working with North American client is mandate and should be able to provide support till 12PM     IST (To cater EST and PST customers)     Experience in Project Management methodologies (PMBOK, PRINCE2) and Scrum methodologies     Experience working with IT application development projects will be an advantage     Proven successful project management experience, preferably delivering large enterprise-based applications     and solutions.     Innovative thinker, high attention to detail, and thoroughness     Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to identify issues, solve them quickly and well,     and know when to rely on internal resources to assist     Strong conflict resolution skills     Superb organizational skills to be able to coordinate complicated projects. column2: Continuous Improvement Practitioners are responsible for analyzing, maintaining, and improving organizational performance. They use a variety of skills, such as project design, leadership, and management to ensure performance and process development. They also function as process analysts, business strategists, and project supervisors. The role requires excellent communication and people skills, as well as the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.                Primary Responsibilities and Activities            Develop and implement process improvements to increase efficiency and productivity at targeted locations.      Analyze and evaluate existing processes and show areas for improvement.      Monitor and measure the effectiveness of process improvements.      Provide training and support to employees on process improvement methodologies.      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful implementation of process improvements.      Develop and maintain process documentation and standard operating procedures.      Function as a change agent to drive continuous improvement culture across the organization.          Job Requirements            Continuous Improvement Manager certification.      Demonstrated ability to work in high paced and changing environments.          Working Conditions            There is a requirement and expectation of this role for some travel to other sites and/or offices within Harsco. This role will report into the Regional President of France with a dotted line to the Harsco Environmental Director of Continuous Improvement.            Qualifications            Bachelors degree in business administration, finance, industrial engineering, mechanical engineering, or a related field.      Quality improvement methodologies such as Lean and Six Sigma      3+ years experience in process improvement, project management, or related field.      Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.      Excellent communication and people skills.        - Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

column2: Role & responsibilities     - Establish and maintain the Project Management Office (PMO) to ensure consistent project management practices across the organization. - Develop and implement project management policies, processes, and standards. - Monitor project progress and performance, with strong attention to details for identifying and addressing issues and risks in a timely manner. - Collaborate and Coordinate with stakeholders to define project objectives, scope, and deliverables. - Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among project teams using Microsoft Teams and other tools. - Develop and actively maintain project schedules, budgets, and resource plans using Microsoft Project. - Prepare reports, presentation and documents as required for MIS presentation to MD on regular basis and to key stake holders as required. - Track and report on project metrics and KPIs to managing director and senior management. - Conduct project reviews and lessons learned sessions to continuously improve project delivery processes. - Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in project management, particularly within the pharmaceutical sector. Preferred candidate profile   Qualifications and Experience: - Masters degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business Administration, Project Management). - Minimum of 5-10 years of experience in a Project Management Office (PMO) role, with a proven track record of successfully managing complex projects. - Strong knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g., PMBOK, Agile) and tools (e.g., Microsoft Project). - Experience working in the pharmaceutical industry is highly desirable. - Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. - Certification in project management (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) is a plus. Interested Candidate can send CV on shital@mjbiopharm.com or contact on 9619744167 .

column2: Across Levels Comms & Media Networks Join our team in Strategy consulting to find endless opportunities and solve  our clients' toughest challenges, as you  collaborate  with  exceptional people, the latest technology, and leading companies across industries. Practice:  Comms & Media , Industry Consulting,  S&C  Global Network (GN) Areas of Work:  Fiber Network Strategy & Architecture, Fiber Network Rollout and Design  Level: Analyst or Consultant  Location: Delhi Gurgaon, Mumbai,  Bengaluru , Pune, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Chennai Years of Exp: 1- 7 years Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture Are you an outcome-oriented problem solver? Do you enjoy working on transformation strategies for global clients? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest?  Then,  is the right place for you to explore limitless possibilities. Comms & Media (C&M) is one of the Industry Practices within Accenture's  S&C  Global Network (GN Team) in Strategy & Consulting (S&C ).  It focuses in serving clients across specific Industries Communications, Media & Entertainment. Communications  Focuses primarily on industries related with telecommunications and information & communication technology (ICT). This dynamic team serves most of the world's leading wireline, wireless, cable and satellite communications and service providers.  Media & Entertainment  Focuses on industries like broadcast, entertainment, print and publishing.  Globally,  works to develop value growth strategies for its clients, who are top-notch organizations, and help improve their offers and go-to-market performance and maximize organizational effectiveness. We work on end-to-end projects delivering management and technology consultancy to help our clients achieve greater profitability, quality, and reliability. From multi-year major systems integration transformation deals to shorter more agile engagements, we have a rapidly expanding portfolio of hyper-growth clients and an increasing footprint with next-gen technology and industry practices, with the following requirements: Deep expertise  in one or more  Telecom Domains Lead delivery of small to medium-size teams  to deliver management consulting projects for global clients.  Lead innovation transformation  programs and process enablement for our clients  Take responsibility within Comms & Media industry group  or across the Products group, help build the practice, track metrics, and so on.  Develop assets and methodologies , point-of-view, research, or white papers for use by the team and larger community.  Support global sales team to identify and win potential opportunities  within the practice. Help in drafting proposals as an expert for domain areas.  Lead proposals, business development efforts  and coordinate with other colleagues to create consensus-driven deliverables.  Understand  customer needs and translate them to business requirements, business process flows and functional requirements  Experience  to engage with stakeholders independently  Execute a transformational change plan aligned with client's business strategy  and context for change. Engage stakeholders in the change journey and build commitment for change.  Bring your best skills forward to excel in the role ! Technical  Experience Must-Have Experience in Telecom networks process designfor Fiber network planning and design, Fiber network operations and Fiber deployments for B2B & B2C business  Good knowledge and experience of digital, analytical, FTTx use cases in the Fiber network planning, operations, deployments areas.  Experience in Fiber network due diligence, network migration, CAPEX optimization, network analytics and reporting  Solutioning experience in Fiber design & rollout  Sound understanding of technical requirements for broadband network, high levelFTTxarchitecture.  Working knowledge of Fiber network infrastructure (passive and active broadband network parts, relevant technology, and network elements)  Experience in vendor onboarding, monitoring & reporting, capacity planning and management  Good experience in establishingcommand centre, OSS integration with IT applications.  Delivery experience of Telecom networks process in Network Operations of FTTx. Example: Service Delivery, Service Assurance, Field Force Management, Asset management, Network Inventory, Customer Complaint Handling, NOC / SOCetc.  Good To Have Understanding of broadband network generations, network architecture and ITU/3GPP/ETSI specifications  Familiar with GSMA, Dark Fiber deployments  Understanding of telecom broadband network ecosystem  Understand clients /Fiber Rollout needs and goals and provide recommendations on best practices to ensure high-quality service delivery to clients.  Recommend clients' technical teams on Fiber network services, standards, and industry best practices and methodologies.  Understanding of ITSM tools ecosystem like:Service Now, BMC Remedy, JIRA, Nokia, HP etc.  Working knowledge of Automation across RPA / Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning etc. will be a plus.  Understanding of defining value driver trees translating into value components and key KPIs linked to Business objectives.  Core Skills  required  at least in one or more roles Experience in the role of Functional Business Analyst, Product Owners, Process Designers, Service Designers, Scrum Master's  Value Architect and Tracking - Define value driver trees translating into value components and key KPIs linked to Business objectives  Qualification Role Expectations : Project Delivery Work in teams to deliver projects for global clients, and be responsible, with minimal supervision, for: Independently liaise with customers and convincingly present solutions - especially in an unstructured and ever-changing client environment. Be able to independently question the customer, when required Gather business requirements from client stakeholders via interactions like interviews and workshops  Understand customer needs and translate them to business requirements (business requirement definition), business process flows and functional requirements thereby acting as an interface between business and technology teams Ability to understand the as-is process; understand issues with the processes which can be resolved either through technology or process solutions and design detail level to-be process with all stakeholders Engage all the stakeholders as a virtual team (Customer, Development and Accounts team, Product manager, operations) for sales origination, solutioning and delivery Propose solutions to the client based on gap analysis for the existing platforms against industry benchmarks Business Development: Support global sales team to identify and win potential opportunities  within the practice.
